result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaun M. Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
3:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shaun M. Lee in court, in custody from DCI.  Attorney Shelly Tomtschik in court for Shaun M. Lee. A. Standaert - Clerk 

22CF70, 21CT179, 21TR3204, 21TR3205, 21TR3206, 21TR3207, 21TR3208, 22TR1235

State - all cases are resolved today
21CT179 - deft will enter plea to Ct 1 of 21CT179, Ct 2 merged and dismissed - $1504 (includes BDF), 10 days jail, 12 month revocation of DL, AODA and DSP, IID - 0 days jail credit
22CF70 - will waive PH, Ct 1-24 months probation-absolute sobriety, AODA and follow through, follow recommendations of agent, not to be in the presence of drug paraphernalia or controlled substances, costs of $538 and Ct 3-$1819 (includes BDF), 60 days jail, 24 month rev of DL, AODA and DSP, IID-credit for 131 days

Atty Tomtschik - agrees that is the joint agreement
Court - reads charges and max penalties
Deft - enters a guilty plea to Ct 1 of 21CT179
Court - speaks to deft's right to preliminary hearing
Deft - waives preliminary hearing in 22CF70
Court - finds probable cause and binds deft over for trial, reads charges and max penalties of 22CF70
Deft - enters a guilty plea Ct 1 of 22CF70 and a guilty plea to Ct 3 of 22CF70, waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea.

Court - finds waiver of rights & plea voluntary, free & knowing & approves stip by parties to facts
Accepts guilty pleas and finds defendant guilty 

State - asks Court to accept joint recommendation on both cases
Atty Tomtschik - also asks Court to accept joint recommendation
Deft - makes statement to the Court

Court Orders:
21CT179 Ct 1
  - Fine of $1,504 (includes BDF)
  - 10 days of jail - concurrent to any other sentence
  - 12 month revocation of DL
  - Complete an AODA assessment and driver's safety plan
  - IID
  - 0 days credit if revoked
  - Submit a DNA sample

22CF70 Ct 1
  - sentence withheld, 24 months probation - concurrent to any other sentence
        - Absolute sobriety
        - Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations
        - Follow recommendations of probation officer
        - Not to be in the possession or presence of drug paraphernalia or controlled substances
        - Pay court costs of $538
        - Submit a DNA sample

22CF70 Ct 3
  - Fine of $1,819 (includes BDF)
  - 60 days jail - concurrent to any other sentence
  - 24 months revocation of DL
  - Complete an AODA assessment and driver's safety plan
  - IID
  - Credit for 131 days
  - Submit a DNA sample

Dismissed and read-in: Ct 2 of 21CT179 is merged into Ct 1 and dismissed, Ct 2 of 22CF70 21TR3204, 21TR3205, 21TR3206, 21TR3207, 21TR3208, 22TR1235
Order to Transport for Court on July 14, 2022 at 3:00 PM
